meanings.definition: The quality or state of being idle or lazy.
meanings.sent1: His faineance was evident as he lounged on the couch all day.
meanings.sent2: Her faineance prevented her from completing any tasks on time.
meanings.sent3: Despite his faineance, he managed to finish the project just in time.
meanings.sent4: The garden's faineance in winter was a stark contrast to its vibrant summer bloom.
meanings.sent5: The cat's faineance was interrupted by a sudden burst of energy as it chased a butterfly.

meanings.sent1: The student's faineance led to poor grades in school.
meanings.sent2: She overcame her faineance by setting small daily goals.
meanings.sent3: His faineance was so extreme that even the sloth would be impressed.
meanings.sent4: The faineance of the old clock was a reminder of its long years of service.
meanings.sent5: The faineance of the clouds made the day seem endless and slow.
